data.title: Reverse Mode Challenge
data.solution:
t = input().split(" ")
words = []
for c in t:
    words.append(c[::-1])
print(*words, sep=" ")
data.statement: Write a program/function that takes a string [[t]] as input and returns a string where each word in [[t]] has been reversed while maintaining their original order.

data.constraints:
The length of the input string will not exceed 255 characters.
The words in the input string will contain only alphabets, spaces, and punctuation
data.inputDescription: The input consists of a single string [[t]] containing a series of words separated by spaces. The string may contain alphabets, spaces, punctuation, and special characters. The length of the string will not exceed 255 characters.
data.outputDescription: Output a string where each word in the input string has been reversed while maintaining their original order.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Write a program/function that takes a string t as input and returns a string where each word in t has been reversed while maintaining their original order.
Input
The input consists of a single string t containing a series of words separated by spaces. The string may contain alphabets, spaces, punctuation, and special characters. The length of the string will not exceed 255 characters.
Output
Output a string where each word in the input string has been reversed while maintaining their original order.
Constraints
The length of the input string will not exceed 255 characters.
The words in the input string will contain only alphabets, spaces, and punctuation
Example
Input
coding is fun
Output
gnidoc si nuf
